class src.utils.BaseModule.BaseInput(input_data: dict)

Bases: object

class src.utils.BaseModule.BaseModule(module_name: str)

Bases: object

Represents a module that can process data according to specified configurations and tools.

get_author()

Retrieves the author of the module.

Returns:

The author’s name.

Return type:

str

get_description()

Retrieves the description of the module.

Returns:

The description of the module.

Return type:

str

get_disk_only()

Checks if the module operates only on disk without requiring multithreading support.

Returns:

True if the module requires disk access only, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

get_env()

Retrieves the environment variable settings specific to the module’s operation.

Returns:

A list of environment variable strings, typically in ‘KEY=VALUE’ format.

Return type:

list

get_input_details() → BaseInput

Retrieves input configuration details for the module, which define how input data should be handled.

Returns:

A dictionary representing the input configuration details.

Return type:

dict

get_module_name()

Retrieves the name of the module.

Returns:

The module name.

Return type:

str

get_no_multithread()

Determines if the module is designed to operate without multithreading.

Returns:

True if the module does not support multithreading, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

get_os()

Retrieves the operating system for which the module is designed.

Returns:

The operating system name.

Return type:

str

get_output_details() → dict[str, Any]

Retrieves output configuration details for the module, which define how the output should be formatted and stored.

Returns:

A dictionary representing the output configuration details.

Return type:

dict

get_processor_os()

Retrieves the operating system type that is compatible with the processor used by the module.

Returns:

The processor’s operating system type.

Return type:

str

get_processor_type()

Retrieves the types of processors that the module can utilize.

Returns:

A list of processor types (e.g., ‘internal’, ‘external’).

Return type:

List[str]

get_requirements()

Retrieves the requirements for the module. Each requirement is ensured to end with ‘.yml’.

Returns:

A list of requirements, each formatted with a ‘.yml’ extension.

Return type:

List[str]

get_type()

Retrieves the type of the module.

Returns:

The type of the module.

Return type:

str

class src.utils.BaseModule.BaseTool(tool_data: dict, env: list)

Bases: object

Handles operations for different tools by executing commands both locally and remotely.

run_local(is_agent=False, timeout=3600) → bool

Executes the tool command locally.

Parameters:

  • is_agent (bool) – Specifies whether the command is run in an agent context.

  • timeout (int) – Maximum time in seconds before the command times out.

Returns:

A tuple containing the command’s stdout and stderr.

Return type:

Tuple[Optional[str], Optional[str]]

run_remote()

Executes the tool command remotely via WinRM.

Returns:

A tuple containing a boolean indicating success, and output or error message.

Return type:

Tuple[bool, str]

run_wsl(timeout=3600)

Placeholder function for future WSL command execution implementation.

run_wsl_bak()

Placeholder function for future WSL command execution implementation.

transform_cmd(is_agent)

Placeholder function for transforming the command based on agent context.

update_env()

Updates the environment variables for the tool command execution.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the updated environment variables.

Return type:

dict

src.utils.BaseProfile module

class src.utils.BaseProfile.BaseProfile(profile_name: str)[source]

Bases: object

Represents a profile configuration which encompasses multiple modules, potentially with varying requirements and configurations.

get_data() → Any[source]

Loads the profile data from a YAML file.

Returns:

The data loaded from the YAML file.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

Exception – If the file could not be loaded.

validate_modules_configs()[source]

Validates the configurations of all modules included in the profile. Checks include verifying file paths, operating system compatibility, and requirement fulfillment among the modules.

Raises:

SystemExit – If any validation checks fail.

Bases: object

check_input_dir(case_uuid, input_dir)[source]

Checks if the specified input directory or its sub-items are currently being processed in any table except ‘master_status’. Following table are excluded : ‘processing_done’, ‘case_snapshot’ :param case_uuid: The UUID of the case. :type case_uuid: str :param input_dir: The path of the input directory to check. :type input_dir: str

Returns:

True if the input directory or its sub-items are currently being processed, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

check_input_file(case_uuid, input_file)[source]
close()[source]

Close the database connection.

create_table_processing_status(table_name)[source]

Create a table for processing status if it doesn’t exist.

Parameters:

table_name (str) – The name of the table to create.

get_stored_case_snapshot(case_path)[source]

Retrieve stored directory entries for the specified case UUID.

Parameters:

case_path (str) – The path of the case.

Returns:

A list of (path, entry_type) tuples.

Return type:

list

is_processing_active(case_uuid)[source]

Check if there is at least one table with a row for the given case_uuid that has a column processing_status not equal to ‘processing_done’. Following table are excluded : ‘processing_done’, ‘case_snapshot’

Parameters:

case_uuid (str) – The case UUID.

Returns:

True if such a row exists, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

store_case_snapshot(case_uuid, case_path, entries_list)[source]
store_data(case_path, module: BaseModule, status, case_uuid)[source]

Store data into the specified module’s table.

Parameters:

  • case_path (str) – The case path.

  • module (BaseModule) – The module instance containing data to store.

  • status (str) – The processing status.

  • case_uuid (str) – The case UUID.

store_master_status(case_path, status, case_uuid, modules_selected)[source]

Store or update the master status for a given case.

Parameters:

  • case_path (str) – The case path.

  • status (str) – The processing status.

  • case_uuid (str) – The case UUID.

  • modules_selected (str) – The selected modules.

Parameters:

  • module (BaseModule) – The module instance containing data to update.

  • status (str) – The processing status.

  • case_uuid (str) – The case UUID.

Modifies the command string for remote execution, incorporating environmental variables and configuration specifics.

update_command_wsl()[source]

src.utils.SmbMounter module

class src.utils.SmbMounter.SMBMounter(mount_point, username=None, password=None, version='3.0', check_interval=15)[source]

Bases: object

Manages the mounting, monitoring, and unmounting of an SMB share, ensuring continuous accessibility.

mount()[source]

Attempts to mount the SMB share at the specified mount point.

Returns:

True if the share is successfully mounted, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

start_monitoring()[source]

Starts a background thread that continuously monitors the mount point to ensure it remains mounted and accessible.

stop_monitoring()[source]

Stops the monitoring thread.

unmount()[source]

Attempts to unmount the SMB share.

Returns:

True if the share is successfully unmounted, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

src.utils.singleton module

src.utils.singleton.singleton(cls)[source]

Decorator to transform a class into a singleton. Ensures that only one instance of the class exists within the application.

Parameters:

cls (type) – The class to be transformed into a singleton.

Returns:

A wrapper function that manages the instantiation of the singleton class, ensuring only one instance is created.

Return type:

function
